title: What are the techniques and principles of non-verbal hypnosis?
first_phrase: This final section of the text covers the topic of non-verbal communication in hypnosis and how it can be used to induce states of ecstasy. The section includes a demo of non-verbal hypnotism and discusses techniques such as magnetic passes, touches, and sounds. It also delves into the interpretation of reactions and the neurological and psychological implications of non-verbal hypnosis. The section concludes with an exercise to create ecstasy using a mirror and music, and emphasizes the importance of having a positive presence to be perceived as a positive symbol for the client.

last_phrase: In conclusion, these techniques and exercises aim to help therapists enhance their skills and increase their therapeutic effectiveness. From practicing proxemics to utilizing the four-step therapy principles and hypnodrama method, therapists can create a positive atmosphere, attune to their clients' needs, and work towards resolving emotional issues. The use of non-verbal hypnosis, fluidification, magnetism, and moving therapy can also help balance emotions, increase sensitivity, and induce deep somnambulism. By understanding different types of personalities and muscular preferences, therapists can tailor their approach to each client and achieve better results. With dedication and practice, therapists can become more present and effective in their work.
